articles.description: Neal Stephenson coined the term “metaverse” in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel “Snow Crash.” Now he’s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in “Snow Crash,” goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse

articles.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver

articles.description: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.
articles.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'

articles.description: Miguel Faus funded his upcoming film "Calladita" via NFT sales and a prize grant from Decentralized Pictures and Steven Soderbergh. He told Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how the film process is progressing and how Web3 moves so quickly that the NFT funding model he used is already a thing of the past and other filmmakers need to find other ways to keep pushing the envelope.
articles.title: 'Calladita' Director Says NFT Funding Model He Used Is Already Gone Because Web3 Moves So Fast

articles.description: Coinbase protocols lead Jesse Pollak sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2023 to talk about the company's innovation strategy and its plans to keep "iterating quickly" on products like Coinbase NFT and its newly announced Layer-2 blockchain Base and its efforts to become an "on-chain-native company."
articles.title: Coinbase Protocols Lead Talks Plans for Base and NFT Marketplace

articles.description: Josie Bellini, NFT artist and creator of CyberBrokers, tells Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris how CyberBrokers creates "missions and quests" for its holders to complete that lead them to other hubs like Cryptovoxels, Mona, and other projects "so that we're not just in our own silo."
articles.title: How CyberBrokers Creates Quests Across Multiple NFT Communities: Josie Bellini

articles.description: Bolero co-founder and CEO William Bailey tells Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris how Bolero works, the vision behind letting fans of an artist own a piece of a song, the future for music NFTs, and how Web3 can change the music industry broadly.
articles.title: Web3 Music Platform Bolero Wants to 'Put a Record Label in Everyone's Pocket'

articles.description: French electronic music producer DJ Agoria told Decrypt's Dan Roberts what excites him most about music NFTs, how it informs his work as a generative artist, and why Web3 is all about artists exploring "new ideas that were not possible in Web2."
articles.title: 'We Don't Want to Make Music NFTs Mainstream': DJ Agoria

articles.description: Adidas Web3 lead Erika Wykes-Sneyd told Decrypt's Dan Roberts the story of what prompted Adidas to get into crypto (it involves Elon Musk), what the brand has done so far with NFTs tied to physical apparel, and what it's considering next—including token-gated sneaker drops.
articles.title: How Adidas Jumped Into Web3 and What It Plans Next

articles.description: Eva Assayag, Web3 lead at Panerai, sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about Panerai's Web3 strategy, which will soon include a "digital passport" sold with every watch.
articles.title: Why 160-Year-Old Luxury Watch Maker Panerai Is Getting into NFTs

articles.description: John Karp, president of NFT Factory Paris and the founder of Non-Fungible Conference Lisbon, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the exploding Web3 community in Paris, the concept behind creating a physical gallery for NFTs, and how the existing art community understands NFTs because "everybody understands art."
articles.title: NFT Factory President: 'NFTs Will Be Active in a Bull or Bear Market'

articles.description: Tom Sachs is a conceptual artist whose work has been displayed in museums and galleries all over the world, but he told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris he never before felt part of an art movement—until he got into NFTs and Web3. He talked about Rocket Factory and the pull of Web3 art communities.
articles.title: What Attracted Artist Tom Sachs to NFTs? Community and Identity

articles.description: Pierre-Nicolas Hurstel, CEO of Arianee, which offers enterprise software to consumer brands to help them launch NFTs tied to physical goods, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how much the NFT space is growing despite the bear market, how big consumer brands will take crypto mainstream, and how loyalty programs are going to be the next huge use case for NFTs.
articles.title: Arianee CEO: Big Consumer Brands Are Going to Take Web3 to 1 Billion Users

articles.author: Christian Encila
articles.description:
Six executives of the Ponzi scheme AirBit Club have admitted their guilt in a fraud and money laundering scheme that allegedly bilked victims out of $100 million, according to prosecutors. 
 
On March 8, one of the founders, Pablo Renato Rodriguez, pleaded guilty to charges of wire fraud conspiracy.
 
 
AirBit Club Ponzi Scheme Exposed
 
AirBit Club was a global scam in which promoters organized “lavish expos” and community presentations across the United States, South America, Eastern Europe, and Asia, and enticed victims to invest in “memberships” that were said to generate returns through cryptocurrency mining and trading.
 
Using an online portal, victims could monitor their “balances,” but the numbers were fictitious and they were unable to withdraw funds.
 
 
Operators and attorney o…
articles.title: AirBit: Execs Of Fake Crypto Trading Firm Plead Guilty To $100 Million Ponzi Scheme

articles.author: Damian Chmiel
articles.description:
Hut 8 Mining Corp., one of North America's largest publicly-listed mining companies, recently announced its financial results for the year and quarter that ended 31 December 2022. Despite the challenging times that the digital asset mining industry experienced, Hut 8 managed to maintain stable revenues. However, the total net loss widened significantly to CAD 242.81 million, showing how cryptocurrency winter made crypto miners' life miserable in 2022.

Hut 8 Doubles Net Loss in 2022

Hut 8 revenue decreased by CAD 23.1 million to CAD 150.7 million during the year ended 31 December 2022, compared to CAD 173.8 million reported a year earlier. However, the company mined 3,568
articles.title: BTC Miner Hut 8 Doubles 2022 Net Loss to $176 Million

articles.author: Rudy Gallardo
articles.description:
A volunteer from Guatemala’s Bitcoin Lake project shares the rewards of working on this circular economy.
Bitcoin is a disruptive technology that has emerged as a fundamental component of the financial industry. My work at Bitcoin-friendly companies has allowed me to observe the many ways in which Bitcoin is transforming the industry. Looking to contribute more, I embarked on a Bitcoin-only journey and joined the non-profit project, Bitcoin Lake. 
Located in Panajachel, Guatemala, Bitcoin Lake launched just over a year ago. The project aims to create a circular economy powered by Bitcoin, providing a novel and accessible solution for unbanked as well as banked merchants. In Guatemala, approximately 60% of the adult population doesn't have access to formal financial services, and Bitcoin La…
articles.title: Inside Bitcoin Lake: Lessons From My Months As A Volunteer With Guatemala's Groundbreaking Project

articles.author: Terence Zimwara
articles.description:
According to Hong Kong police, in 2022 there were 2,336 reported crypto scam-related cases in which more than $216.6 million was lost. Although losses relating to crypto scams only constituted just over 10% of the nearly 23,000 reported technology crimes, they still accounted for more than half of the $407.7 million that was lost to online fraudsters. 
 
Crypto-Related Scams Constitute Just Over 10% of Reported Technology Crimes
 
Hong Kong residents reportedly incurred cryptocurrency-related scam losses totaling $216.6 million (HK$1.7 billion), just over half of the $407.7 million that was lost to online scammers in 2022, a report has said. The more-than-double increase in crypto scam-related losses followed a 67% jump in the number of victims from 1,397 reported cases in 2021 to 2,336 by…
articles.title: Report: Hong Kong Residents Lost More Than $216 Million to Crypto Scams in 2022

articles.author: Savannah Fortis
articles.description:
On January 15, the Shiba Inu network announced the Shibarium Layer-2 solution, highlighting the benefits of the new update. However, the developers didn’t provide a specific date for the launch in the announcement. Since then, the community has been anticipating the launch of the Layer-2 network.
 
 
In a recent report, Shiba Inu developers released an essential warning ahead of the launch date for Shibarium, its new blockchain. The developers disclosed that the Shibarium Layer-2 protocol would launch this week, but potential investors and users must be cautious when using the L2 solution. 
 
Shiba Inu Releases Warning To Community
 
According to the tweet posted a few hours ago, Shytoshi Kusama, Shiba Inu’s lead developer, urged users to be careful when using the layer-2 blockchain Shibar…
articles.title: Shiba Inu Dev Alerts Community of Key Considerations For Shibarium Release

articles.author: Savannah Fortis
articles.description:
In a recent development, a crypto investor jabbed Senator Elizabeth Warren for criticizing Silvergate bank. Warren shared a Twitter post, reacting to the recent collapse of the bank and reminding the crypto community of her earlier warnings.
 
 
But the founder of Galaxy Digital, Mike Novogratz, responded to Warren’s posts with sarcasm, mentioning her so-called intelligence and calls for regulators to step up against crypto risk.   
 
Novogratz Reacts Against Senator Warren 
 
In Warren’s post, the senator that “As the bank of choice for crypto, Silvergate Bank’s failure is disappointing but predictable. I warned of Silvergate’s risky, if not illegal, activity—and identified severe due diligence failures. Now, customers must be made whole & regulators should step up against crypto risk.”
 …
articles.title: Mike Novogratz Claps Back At Sen. Warren Over Silvergate Criticism

articles.author: Lubomir Tassev
articles.description:
Internet users in Russia have been targeted in an email campaign advertising the launch of an alleged cryptocurrency issued by the state. Potential victims are encouraged to follow a link to the website of the fraudulent investment scheme, security experts said.
 
Thousands of Investment Offers Entice Russians to Put Money Into Non-Existent Cryptocurrency
 
Fraudsters have been sending emails to Russian residents claiming to be writing on behalf of a regulatory body about the upcoming launch of “the Russian state cryptocurrency,” the Tass news agency reported, quoting Kaspersky Lab.
 
“With such messages, attackers lure users to resources where they risk losing money,” the cybersecurity firm explained. Several thousands of these letters had been sent by the end of February, the anti-virus …
articles.title: Fraudsters Offer Russians Bogus Chance to Invest in Fake ‘State Cryptocurrency’

articles.author: Semilore Faleti
articles.description:
The Chairman of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC), Rostin Behnam, has once again reaffirmed the agency’s position that stablecoins should be classified as commodities and placed under its jurisdiction. 
 
At a Senate Agricultural Committee meeting on Wednesday, March 8, the CFTC’s boss re-emphasized this stance while responding to a question raised by New York State Senator Kirsten Gillibrand on the contrasting reports on by the U.S. regulator and its federal counterpart, the Security and Exchange Commission (SEC) the Tether stablecoin. 
 
“Notwithstanding a regulatory framework around stablecoins, they’re going to be commodities in my view.” Benham said,  “It was clear to our enforcement team and the commission that Tether, a stablecoin, was a commodity.”
 
This recent state…
articles.title: CFTC Re-Asserts That Stablecoins Remain Under Its Jurisdiction
